datumFields.label: judgement
datumFields.help: Grammaticality/acceptability judgement (*,#,?, etc). Leaving it blank can mean grammatical/acceptable, or you can choose a new symbol for this meaning.

datumFields.label: utterance
datumFields.help: Unparsed utterance in the language, in orthography or transcription. Line 1 in your LaTeXed examples for handouts. Sample entry: amigas

datumFields.label: morphemes
datumFields.help: Morpheme-segmented utterance in the language. Used by the system to help generate glosses (below). Can optionally appear below (or instead of) the first line in your LaTeXed examples. Sample entry: amig-a-s

datumFields.label: gloss
datumFields.help: Metalanguage glosses of each individual morpheme (above). Used by the system to help gloss, in combination with morphemes (above). It is Line 2 in your LaTeXed examples. We recommend Leipzig conventions (. for fusional morphemes, - for morpheme boundaries etc)  Sample entry: friend-fem-pl

datumFields.label: syntacticCategory
datumFields.help: This optional field is used by the machine to help with search and data cleaning, in combination with morphemes and gloss (above). If you want to use it, you can choose to use any sort of syntactic category tagging you wish. It could be very theoretical like Distributed Morphology (Sample entry: âˆš-GEN-NUM), or very a-theroretical like the Penn Tree Bank Tag Set. (Sample entry: NNS) http://www.ims.uni-stuttgart.de/projekte/CorpusWorkbench/CQP-HTMLDemo/PennTreebankTS.html

datumFields.label: syntacticTreeLatex
datumFields.help: This optional field is used by the machine to make LaTeX trees and help with search and data cleaning, in combination with morphemes and gloss (above). If you want to use it, you can choose to use any sort of LaTeX Tree package (we use QTree by default) Sample entry: Tree [.S NP VP ]

datumFields.label: translation
datumFields.help: Free translation into whichever language your team is comfortable with (e.g. English, Spanish, etc). You can also add additional custom fields for one or more additional translation languages and choose which of those you want to export with the data each time. Line 3 in your LaTeXed examples. Sample entry: (female) friends

datumFields.label: tags
datumFields.help: Tags for constructions or other info that you might want to use to categorize your data.

datumFields.label: validationStatus
datumFields.help: Any number of tags of data validity (replaces DatumStates). For example: ToBeCheckedWithSeberina, CheckedWithRicardo, Deleted etc...

datumFields.label: modifiedByUser
datumFields.help: An array of users who modified the datum

datumFields.label: enteredByUser
datumFields.help: The user who originally entered the datum
